name: Holiday Inn & Suites Across from Universal Orlando

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent two days arriving to Orlando with my partner. It was very conveniently located in Orlando and very close to Universal Studios, where we spent the following morning.
reviews.title: Ok
A bit grim!
reviews.text: Hotel is nothing special. Very family-esque with screaming kids in the swimming pool. Staff are friendly and you can use their free shuttle service to go to Universal Studios.
We wanted to use their gym, but they were refurbishing it, so they gave us free passes to an even better gymnasium, which was a nice treat.
reviews.title: Spend the Extra Money for a better Room

reviews.text: Overall a little bit worn out, old furniture, but clean and handy for Universal studios
reviews.title: Dont waste your money!

reviews.text: We only stayed here because everywhere else was booked solid during the week we wanted in Feb 2007. They gave us a room in the 'Tower' which was obviously some kind of punishment!
reviews.title: Filthy Rooms, Very poor upkeep, Unfriendly staff

likes.disliked: — Everything else i.e. service, cleanlines, staff courtesy

reviews.text: We stayed in a suite - the room was beautiful and VERY clean. All staff were very friendly and helpful (ice machine wasnt working in the fridge, they were there within 5 minutes with a large box of ice).
reviews.title: Loved it...and will be back!

reviews.text: This hotel is right across the street from Universal/Islands of Adventure - it's a beautifully landscaped 10 minute walk to the park entrance. You do have to cross a busy road, but there are signals-had no problems crossing it with my 6 and 11 year olds.
reviews.title: Wouldn't have been my choice, but it was OK

likes.disliked: — not particulary friendly or helpful staff

reviews.title: great price great location
reviews.text: Kids eat free at TGIFridays (which is attached to hotel) but make sure you ask for the "Kids Eat Free" coupon when checking in at the front desk (they forgot to give us ours). Food isn't the best but convenient - I would recommend eating somewhere else if you can.
The pool is heated and very clean - kids had a great time in it.
reviews.title: Nice Suites

reviews.text: I was very impressed with this hotel and will for sure be back.
reviews.title: Yikes!!!! How gross!

reviews.text: This starts our terrible but ends up great so please read entire review. First ,If your not staying in a suite - forget it!! The first day we arrived we payed for 3 rooms. In our room I pulled back the sheets to lay down and found hair and cooked rice in the bed. Yuck! By mid day we had ants crawling in our room. Okay - this can happen. My mother's room had ants too - bad! So we let the front desk know and they said they would spray the rooms. No one ever came so at 10pm at night we were switching to new rooms. What went from bad just got worse. In our room the carpets were damp and the toilet had mold growing on the entire seat! My mother's room had mold growing on the walls - all over the walls! The toilet didn't flush either. This time I went to the manager and spoke with him. The rooms were terrible but the staff from the time we arrived was great! The manager exchanged our rooms to 3 suites at no extra charge and paid for our breakfast the next day. The suites were clean, new and updated. They were fresh and really made the difference. In the rooms there is a plastic desktop that states if your not satisfied they will make it right and they did. I would not return to this hotel unless I was in a suite. There is a restaurant attached (Friday's) but there is a Cracker Barrell, Denny's, Komo's Steak House and two other restraunts all in walking distance. There is a Walgreens in walking distance too. The cab ride to Universal was $3.25 which beats waiting for the trolley or the bus.
reviews.title: Okay, Worse to Great - Please Read Entire Review

likes.liked: — The beds were great - no sagging mattress
likes.disliked: — The rooms were dirty, moldy and with ants

reviews.text: Served the purpose for me and my two teenage children for the week of Aug. 22nd. We booked a suite and it was perfect (two queen size beds and a pull out couch). You can definitely walk to Universal and Islands Of Adventure or just take the shuttle that comes to the hotel at various times through out the day. The room was very clean and we do not have any complaints. There is a computer with free internet access and printing wich came in very handy....also, a games room and gift shop. Adam at the front desk was especially friendly and helpful. Free parking was a bonus. Also, after a long hot day at the theme parks... TJIF is attached to the hotel so you don't have to go far for a nice meal. I would definitely stay there again if I ever went back to Florida.
reviews.title: Served The Purpose

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel on July 4 and 5. The hotel has seen better days. My room had a number of maintenance issues. The high speed internet did not work. It was very difficult to turn on the water in the bathtub and when I took a shower, the water would not turn off. There was also a very bad rust stain in the tub. The toilet did not flush unless you held the handle down. The grout around the tub was black. The stopper for the sink was disconnected. The metal light fixture on the wall between the beds was rusted on top. There were several people on my floor that carried on loud conversations in the hall or in their room with the door open. The rear door to the hotel, which was supposed to be accessed by room key, did not lock. On a positive note, the lobby was nice and it had wireless internet. The proximity to Universal Studios was also a plus. The desk staff was helpful and I was given a discount on my stay due to the problems I encountered.
reviews.title: Not a nice place

reviews.text: Very nice, Great Location, I dont know about the regular rooms but The suites are very clean, spacious,, great service,, definitely I recommend this hotel because when you go to orlando you are going to be out all the time going to differnet parks, etc,, you just need to stay somewhere close to the attractiions, as long as its clean and comfortable and this hotel is perfect .... over all I loved it.......
reviews.title: I Loved It.........

reviews.text: It is a nice hotel for the price and very accessible but imagine that when you wakeup your car have a broken glass and steal you!...the security no appears.....3 night and 8 cars affected....later they put a security officer.....when the people start to complain ....the hotel need renovations!!!
reviews.title: Watch your car!!stealing in the night!!

reviews.text: If you're planning on going to Universal Studios Orlando and you're on a budget, Holiday Inn maingate to Universal (across the street) is definetly the place to book your stay! We had a wonderful experience and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It was clean and comfy and a short walk to Universal/Islands of Adventure/City Walk. Although you do have to cross 5 lanes of traffic initially, the traffic lights do provide you a leisure pace to cross. The walkway to Universal is very clean, peaceful, and tropical. It took us approximately 10 minutes to get to the entrance. Now mind you, this hotel is nothing lavishing or fancy, so if you're looking for something really upscale than you might want to stay in the park and pay a ton of money. But for the price, the Holiday Inn was worth it. The pool was refreshing- and the staff at TGIF's was at hand to serve you food and drinks by the pool. My family and I stayed in a one bedroom suite, (which was great) because we have a teenager and the bedroom provided privacy for my husband and I while my teenage son enjoyed the pull-out sleeper with his own t.v. in the living area. The cleaning service was A+. Our room was cleaned spotless every day and there was plenty of clean towels and extra bedding on hand. Also to keep in mind, while the Double Tree hotel is also within the same vicinity and walking distance, what I didn't like about the Double Tree (if you observe in photos) is that none of their windows open for ventilation. While all the rooms are air conditioned at Holiday Inn (as I'm sure with the Double Tree), at least at the Holiday Inn you're able to get some fresh air from the windows as well. I would definetly recommend this hotel if you're planning a trip to Universal.
reviews.title: Awesome location!

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week beginning May 29. We had a two room suite which was nice, clean and roomy. There were a couple fo drain/faucet problems which they fixed right away. The fitness center was being renovated so they gave passes to a nearby fitness center. I would bypass the information desk as when we asked for about discounted park tickets, they wanted to take us on a resort sales tour. Had plenty of plug ins for the needs of today's traveler.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We spend most of the time out site seeing so this room met our needs for the week.
reviews.title: The Dirtiest Place on Earth

reviews.text: Never, ever again, this place is the dirtiest place that we are stayed in The United States, the bathroom was stinking and dirty and the room smell like a pig
reviews.title: Loved the Holiday Inn Suites Universal Studios

reviews.text: Let me first start by saying, after reading all of the negative reviews on TripAdvisor.com, I was worried about staying at this hotel. However, I did contact the General Manager, Matthew Downs, and he quickly put all of my concerns to rest. He personally gave me all of the personnel contact information that I may need during my stay (just in case something was unsatisfactory during our stay). I could not have asked for better service or a nicer hotel for the price. There were 18 of us and we stayed in 3 of the 2 bedroom suites. It was plenty of room for us. The hotel staff was excellent to deal with and Brenda Keller (the Reservation Manager) made sure all of our needs were met. She is extremely nice, will answer any questions that you may have, and will go out of her way to make sure that your stay is a pleasant one.
reviews.title: Somewhat depressing

aka: Holiday Inn & Suites Main Gate To Universal Orlando Hotel Orlando
description: The Holiday Inn & Suites across from Universal Orlando is located in the heart of Central Florida's exciting attractions, convention and shopping area. Visit our recently renovated hotel just across the street from the Universal Orlando Resort. Our property features a variety of room types to fit any traveler's needs from Deluxe Guest Rooms with two double beds or a king size bed, and spacious One or Two-Bedroom Suites with nicely equipped kitchenette including microwave and refrigerator. Must be at least 21 to stay. Fabulous amenities to enhance your visit to Orlando such as Game Room, Gift Shop, Guest Laundry Facilities and Valet Service, Fitness Center, Business Center, Outdoor Heated Pool and Kids Splash Zone and the Destination Universal Guest Services Desk with discount attraction tickets to Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure, Sea World and Wet n' Wild. Complimentary Limited Scheduled transportation to Universal Orlando, Sea World and Wet n' Wild. Shuttle transportation schedule subject to change seasonally, service provided through the Destination Universal Guest Services Desk, advance reservations required. TGI Friday's Restaurant on-property serving Breakfast Buffet, Lunch and Dinner, Bar offers Happy Hour daily. TGI Friday's also serving room service. Banquet/Meeting facilities feature 12,000 sq. ft. of flexible function space including 6,500 square foot ballroom and 8 break out rooms. Our experienced team will make your stay or event with us special.
